description: Isreali style hotsauce loosely based on schug

ingredients: .25 lbs Dried peppers (The ones I'm using came from Isreal)
recipe: Rehydrate chillis by boiling and then reducing to a simmer for 2 hours then let them cool
After the chillis cool strain them and save the liquid
Poor the strained chillis into your food processor and gind them up fine
Take the ground up mixture and force it through the back of the wire strainer into a large bowl using a large metal spoon
Once you have done this with all of the contents of the food processor dump the red paste into a large skillet
Heat the mixture to a simmer and add the rice vinegar, olive, salt and other spices
Add some of the liquid that we strained from the rehydrated peppers to the mixture to thin it out
Continue to simmer and stir mixture until desired thickness of sauce
At this point taste the sauce to see if it has the desired flavor; feel free to add more of any of the above ingredients to taste.
tools: Medium sized pot with a lid

name: Raede to Go
